alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 11:22AM CST until February 05 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Rusk, San Augustine, Nacogdoches and Shelby Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect flooded paths and secondary roadways. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CST Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.6 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 04/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1130 AM CST.
